The class {{tt|time_zone_link}} represents an alternative name for a time zone.

Users cannot construct {{tt|time_zone_link}} objects. The library implementation creates {{tt|time_zone_link}} objects when it initializes the time zone database and provides {{c|const}} access to these objects.

{{tt|time_zone_link}} is not copyable but does have a defaulted move constructor and a defaulted move assignment operator. However, as users have only {{c|const}} access to {{tt|time_zone_link}} objects, these functions cannot be called in user code without invoking [[cpp/language/ub|undefined behavior]].
